title: Authors and Citation
text: Janssens J (2024). rexpect: Automate Interactions Textual Interfaces. R package version 0.0.1.9000, https://github.com/jeroenjanssens/rexpect.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rexpect: Automate Interactions with Textual Interfaces},   author = {Jeroen Janssens},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.9000},   url = {https://github.com/jeroenjanssens/rexpect}, }

title: Automate Interactions with Textual Interfaces
text: rexpect R package allows automate interactions programs expose text terminal interface. API inspired original Expect tool Don Libes.

title: Automate Interactions with Textual Interfaces
text: Let’s say Python script repeatedly asks number. user enters sum, script prints sum numbers. script exits user presses CTRL-C. ’s contents bin/sum.py: can use rexpect run script interact . Let’s enter numbers 7, 13, 22 see sum : hood, rexpect starts tmux session using tmuxr: can capture output extract sum: ’ve accomplished goal, let’s exit: Oh ’s right, need press CTRL-C exit script: rather simple example demonstrate capabilities rexpect. session taken place inside Docker container SSH. also recorded session using asciinema. look function reference learn rexpect offer.
code: #!/usr/bin/env python3  numbers = []  while True:     user_input = input("Enter a number: ")          if user_input == "sum":         print(f"The sum is: {sum(numbers)}")         continue      try:         numbers.append(float(user_input))     except ValueError:         print("Please enter a valid number.") library(rexpect) #>  #> Attaching package: 'rexpect' #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     prompt  session <- spawn("bin/sum.py", prompt = "^(.*):$") send_lines(session, c("7", "13", "22", "sum"), wait = TRUE) session #> tmuxr pane 42:1.0: [80x23] [history 0/50000, 3912 bytes] %48 (active) print(output <- read_all(session)) #> [1] "Enter a number: 7"   "Enter a number: 13"  "Enter a number: 22"  #> [4] "Enter a number: sum" "The sum is: 42.0"    "Enter a number:" as.numeric(gsub("[^0-9.]", "", output[length(output) - 1])) #> [1] 42 send_lines(session, "exit") read_all(session) #> [1] "Enter a number: 7"            "Enter a number: 13"           #> [3] "Enter a number: 22"           "Enter a number: sum"          #> [5] "The sum is: 42.0"             "Enter a number: exit"         #> [7] "Please enter a valid number." "Enter a number:" send_control_c(session)

title: Command composition — cmd
code: cmd(command = NULL, args = NULL, ...)  cmd_bash(command = NULL)  cmd_r(command = NULL, vanilla = TRUE)  cmd_docker(command = NULL, image, remove = TRUE, volume = NULL, ...)  cmd_asciinema(command = NULL, filename = NULL, overwrite = TRUE)
